p: The sowing, emergence, squaring, flowering, and boll opening dates of cotton were advanced by 0.24, 1.29, 0.91, 2.71 and 0.82 days per decade on average, respectively, whereas the cotton harvest date was delayed by 0.28 days per decade on average from 1981 to 2012 (Fig. 1a). Among the 13 stations, sowing, emergence, squaring, flowering, and boll opening dates were advanced at 7 (53.9%), 8 (61.5%), 9 (69.2%), 10 (76.9%), and 7 (53.8.1%) stations, respectively, and 8 (61.5%) stations presented delayed harvest dates (Fig. 2). Furthermore, from 1981 to 2012, the cotton flowering date was significantly advanced at 7 (53.9%) of the 13 stations, mainly in Hebei and Shandong Provinces, whereas the date was significantly delayed at 2 (15.4%) stations, mainly in Henan Province.
